Since 2008, we had a great reset of the debt markets. Every major government hit 100% of GDP in debt by 2008. That's the Europeans, the Brits, the Americans, Japanese, Chinese. And what they all did was cut rates to zero in 2008. That was essentially a debt jubilee. It's like you don't pay the interest on the debt. That's really what it was. So if you don't pay the interest on the debt, what did they do? They all refined all of their debt, so it's 100% of GDP and debt. So all economic growth essentially goes to paying off the interest payments on the debt. So what you need to do is lower the interest costs of the debt. They did that and every government reset their debt to three to five year. That three to five year cycle is the debt refi cycle. It's exactly how the economy has been working. So you come into year, year four, it's the down year. That's when the economy slows because rates have gone up, because they have to try and refi. What happens is rates then fall.
